newsitem.title: USA: Seagull to file Egypt development next week.
newsitem.headline: Seagull to file Egypt development next week.

text.p: Seagull Energy Corp plans to file a formal development application for its South Hurghada field with the Egyptian petroleum ministry in Cairo next week, chairman Barry Galt told a conference.
He told the Indepent Petroleum Association of America conference here that production would start at 800 barrels per day of crude oil in late Summer and the output would be trucked out.
Output will rise to 6,000 barrels per day some four to five months after that, Galt said.
Segull has a 50 percent share of that.
Galt said that the company's Qarun field in Egypt was producing 34,000 barrels per day and this would rise to more than 40,000 in a week.
"We have adequate capacity to deliver 50,000 barrels per day," Galt said.
The company plans to drill 17 exploitation wells in 1997 and has completed two and has six rigs working on the field.
Althogh noting that most of the company's activity was overseas, Galt said Seagull would drill 27 U.S. exploration wells this year, down from 32 last year.
He added that notwithstanding the decline, the company would more than replace reserves with a few small acquisitions in 1997. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
